Getting Started with Bootstrap

An overview of X1 UI Bootstrap, how to download and use, and more.

Create Bower Registry File

Since X1 UI Boostrap is registered in a private bower, you must create a bower registry file called .bowerrc in your project root populated with the json below in order to point to our private bower registry.

					{
	"registry": "http://x1showcase.emmlabs.ibm.com:5678"
}

Install with Bower

Save installed package into the project’s bower.json dependencies by appending --save to bower install command.

					$ bower install x1-ui-bootstrap --save

X1 UI Bootstrap Source Code

The X1 UI Bootstrap source code bower installed includes the precompiled CSS, font assets, Sass sources, Sass tools, core Bootstrap JavaScript and documentation. More specifically, it includes the following and more:

					x1-ui-bootstrap/
├── app/
│   └── src/
│   │   ├── bootstrap/
│   │   │   ├── bootstrap.js
│   │   │   └── bootstrap.min.js
│   │   ├── x1-ui-bootstrap.scss
│   │   └── x1-ui-sass-tools.scss
├── dist/
│   ├── demo/
│   ├── fonts/
│   │   ├── ux1-glyphicons.eot
│   │   ├── ux1-glyphicons.svg
│   │   ├── ux1-glyphicons.ttf
│   │   └── ux1-glyphicons.woff
│   ├── x1-ui-bootstrap.css
│   └── x1-ui-bootstrap.min.css
├── bower.json
├── CHANGELOG.md
└── README.md

Including X1 UI Bootstrap

Option 1: Linking the CSS

If you are not precompiling your code, add one of the two file paths below to the <head> of your index file.

					<link rel="stylesheet" href="bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/dist/x1-ui-bootstrap.css">
<!-- or -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/dist/x1-ui-bootstrap.min.css">

Option 2: Compiling the CSS

Whether you are using gulp or grunt you want to add one of the two file paths below to a glob.

					"bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/dist/x1-ui-bootstrap.css"
// or
"bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/dist/x1-ui-bootstrap.min.css"

Copying the Font Directory

If you are not compiling your code, make sure to copy the path below to your application's directory.
If you are compiling your code, make sure to add the path below to a glob.

					"bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/dist/fonts"

Using Sass Tools (optional)

In order to use X1 UI Bootstrap variables and mixins in your Sass files the x1-ui-sass-tools.scss file needs to imported, just like in this example:

					@import "../bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/app/src/x1-ui-sass-tools.scss";

Including Core Bootstrap JavaScript (optional)

This step allows you to use Bootstrap's Core Components.

Option 1: Linking the JS

Add one of the two file paths below to the end of your <body>.

					<script type="text/javascript"src="bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/app/src/bootstrap/bootstrap.js"></script>
<!-- or -->
<script type="text/javascript" src="bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/app/src/bootstrap/bootstrap.min.js"></script>

Option 2: Compiling the JS

Add one of the two file paths below to the end of your build logic.

					"bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/app/src/bootstrap/bootstrap.js"
// or
"bower_components/x1-ui-bootstrap/app/src/bootstrap/bootstrap.min.js"
